channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Ref 8223759, 29th September
item.description:
I reported flags having been put up in Granville Road over this weekend and see that my report has been closed with a generic message which I had read when making the report. The flags are causing a lot of annoyance and anxiety on our street which I have been witness to speaking to, and reading Street WhatsApp messages. The flags are being interpreted as intimidating and passive aggressive. They were put up without consensus of the street and were placed there around midnight on Saturday. My neighbour heard a ladder being put up and was too scared to look out of the window. We are a close, multi-cultural and inclusive street and would like these flags removed. I personally do not want to have sight of the flag opposite my bedroom window. The flags have not been put up for celebratory purposes. The mere nature of how and when they were put up suggests that it was for intimidating and passive aggressive, extremist purposes. If you will not send someone to remove them, please provide the details of who I can contact to take this matter further. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Granville Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: An old dining chair and bags of rubbish dumped, 29th September
item.description:
An old dining chair and some black bags of rubbish have been dumped on the pavement by the fence of The Limes Close. They have been there since last week and now the black bags are broken open. Children walk along here to school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, The Limes Avenue, New Southgate, London

item.title: Always loads of rubbish, 29th September
item.description:
